title: Brush fire prompts evacuation of neighborhood in Laguna Beach
content: LAGUNA BEACH, Calif. (KABC) --  A wind-driven brush fire spread to 50 acres in south Orange County on Saturday afternoon, prompting the evacuation of Laguna Beach's Top of the World neighborhood amid a response from at least 200 firefighters, officials said.  The so-called Aliso Fire was burning in heavy brush in Wood Canyon, located behind Aliso Viejo's Soka University of America, an Orange County Fire Authority spokesperson tweeted at 1:46 p.m.     There were no immediate reports of injuries or structural damage.  Four helicopters and two fixed-wing aircraft were en route to the scene, according to the OCFA spokesperson.  DEVELOPING: More details will be added to this report as they become available.    UPDATE: Alert OC message launched to Old Top of the World for immediate evacuations. Suzi Q center is being set up as care and reception center.  — Laguna Beach PD PIO (@LBPD_PIO_45) June 2, 2018    (Copyright ©2018 KABC-TV. All Rights Reserved.)
